nest.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a place made or chosen by a bird to lay its eggs in and to live in
nest.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: In May the females build a nest and lay their eggs.
Young eagles leave the nest after only two months.
nest.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a place where insects or small animals live
nest.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: Swallows build their nests out of mud.
Barn owls leave the nest at two to three months.
a wasps' nest in the attic
nest.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to build or use a nest
nest.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: They say eagles used to nest in those rocks.
nest.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to organize information, especially in a computer program, so that some of the information is recognized as separate but is included or contained in a larger part of the information
nest.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: Phrases are nested in the dictionary entry for the first major word.
